security: The WFO paper is classified "Top Secret" because it contains excerpts of material from CIA so classified. (4)
summary: This memo, dated September 20, 1968, from the FBI's Washington Metropolitan Field Office (WMFO) to FBI Director compares a CIA paper examining the bona fides of KGB defector "NORMAN" (Yuri Nosenko) with information from recent interrogations of "SAMMY," another defector, and finds deficiencies in the CIA's conclusions.
summary_one_paragraph: The FBI memo, originating from WMFO and addressed to the FBI Director, concerns the evaluation of KGB defector Yuri Nosenko, codenamed "NORMAN." It transmits a paper prepared by WMFO agents that compares a CIA assessment of Nosenko's defection with insights gained from interrogations of another defector, "SAMMY." The WMFO analysis suggests that the CIA's earlier conclusions, which deemed Nosenko a non-bona fide defector, were based on deficient interrogations and inadequate collateral inquiries. The memo highlights significant inaccuracies in the CIA paper regarding specific cases and identifies new cases and confirmatory information obtained during the more recent interrogations.
title: NOSENKO BONA FIDES
